intro: Rosa canina var. andegavensis, commonly known as the Andegavensis dog rose, is a subspecies of the common dog rose. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring thorny stems and compound leaves. The flowers are pink to red, with five petals, and appear in clusters during late spring to early summer. The plant produces red, hairy berries that are rich in vitamin C and are used in traditional medicine. It is native to parts of Europe and thrives in well-drained soils in sunny locations.
